17/06 ; EDIT : so i just finish the book i am here to talk about it , in general the book is good , but i found some difficulty in finding who‚Äôs talking and also the way the book was written is odd because i found dialogues without the ‚Äú ‚Äú or who talking, but i always find out who its just that made my excitement a little off , but i loved the story, another problem, i advice you to read the book if you didn‚Äôt watch the movie , because i was comparing things in my head and i didn‚Äôt want to but i couldn‚Äôt stop myself and this bothered me so much , i always want to imagine things myself, anyways i loved the story so much it‚Äôs heartbreaking but it‚Äôs totally what i want something that made you feel something.

üè∑Ô∏è #elio #elioperlman #callmebyyournamebook #elioandoliver #beckoliveredit #elioandoliverüè≥Ô∏è‚Äçüåà #autunno #fallaesthetic #bookishpost #booklover #gilmoregirls #starshollow #rorygilmore #autunnoreading #bookstagram #cozybedroom #roominspo #fallbedroom #autumndecor #chamberlaincoffee #autumnbookstagram #cozyreading #esteticostudio #aestheticroom #darkacademia #darkacademiaaesthetic #academia #deadpoetssociety #downtowngirl #autunno

"People who read are hiders. They hide who they are. people who hide don't always like who they are."

plot.
A summer on the Riviera, one of those summers that mark life forever. Elio is seventeen years old, and for him the holidays have just begun in the splendid family villa in western Liguria.
The son of a university professor, a sensitive musician, decidedly cultured for his age, the boy expects, like every year, 'the guest of the summer, yet another annoyance': a student who comes from New York to work on his thesis doctorate. But Oliver, the young American, conquers everyone with his beauty and his casual manner.  Elio is also enmeshed.  In addition to their Jewish origins, the two share many passions: they discuss films, books, go for walks and bike rides. And between them comes an inexorable and unexpected desire, lived to the end, from suffering to ecstasy.  Call me by your name is the story of a paradise discovered and already lost, a Proustian meditation on time and desire, a question that remains open until Elio and Oliver find themselves one day confessing to themselves that 'was never more tempting us‚Äô. 

my opinion. i read after watching the movie and i think this book changed my life in an indescribable way.  it has been of great help to me in a difficult period‚Ä¶ I recommend reading it in the summer to fully experience the vibes it offers us. wonderful book

Author: Andr√© Aciman 
Rating: 5‚≠êÔ∏è

üçëReview: 
This book will always have a special place in my heart. It‚Äôs one of my favorite novels ever. Aciman‚Äôs writing is absolutely brilliant. 

Set in a beautiful summer in northern Italy, the romance between Elio and Oliver is one of those tormented with passion, and the kind of love you live only once. 

This is for sure one of the most beautiful romance I‚Äôve ever read, so bold, poetic, sweet and sad. I couldn‚Äôt stop reading even when I was crying like a baby. 

I actually read the book after watching the movie which is a great adaptation. It‚Äôs the exact same vibe as in the novel and Timoth√©e Chalamet is the ideal Elio. 

The second book, Find Me, is more about Elio‚Äôs father but of course we also follow Elio when he‚Äôs older. I enjoyed this book too but I think it was not that necessary to write more after the end of Call Me by Your Name, the ending was absolutely perfect.

Call Me By Your Name 5/5‚≠êÔ∏è

This book will forever be in my heart. I will always think it is one of the best things I‚Äôve read. Something about the passion and emotion throughout it is so enchanting, from the first ‚ÄúLater!‚Äù I was caught in a trace with this book.

I remember the first time I read it I was maybe 14, roughly when it came out. I watched the movie first which my friend had introduced to me and I was so intrigued that I had to get the book. Ever since then it holds a special place in my heart. It‚Äôs very emotional but exciting all at the same time. Worth every word read.
